channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Farmers are abandoning their land. Is that good for nature?
item.description: Traditional farmers around the world are walking away from millions of acres of land where they once grew crops or grazed animals. It's provoking mixed reactions.
item.content:encoded:
Traditional farmers around the world are walking away from millions of acres of land where they once grew crops or grazed animals. It's provoking mixed reactions.

(Image credit: Dan Charles)
item.dc:creator: Dan Charles

item.title: A record number of migrants reached the Canary Islands by sea in 2024, Spain says
item.description: The number beats the previous record, set in 2023, as a recent report also points at a peak in the number of deaths recorded in the dangerous Atlantic migration route.
item.content:encoded:
The number beats the previous record, set in 2023, as a recent report also points at a peak in the number of deaths recorded in the dangerous Atlantic migration route.

(Image credit: Antonio Sempere)
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: Biden to award Medal of Honor to Korean and Vietnam War veterans
item.description: The Medal of Honor, the United States' highest military decoration, is awarded to service members who display exceptional valor in combat.
item.content:encoded:
The Medal of Honor, the United States' highest military decoration, is awarded to service members who display exceptional valor in combat.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Lexie Schapitl

item.title: For angry airline passengers, an apologist-in-chief smooths things over
item.description: In this week's StoryCorps, we hear from a former Southwest Airlines employee whose job was to apologize to customers who had a bad travel experience.
item.content:encoded: In this week's StoryCorps, we hear from a former Southwest Airlines employee whose job was to apologize to customers who had a bad travel experience.
item.dc:creator: Liyna Anwar

item.title: Assessing the Damage at Lebanon's Historical Sites
item.description: Part of a Crusader castle collapsed. An 18th century minaret toppled. Church mosaics burned. Israeli airstrikes have damaged priceless antiquities across Lebanon & Syria during it's war with Hezbollah. With a ceasefire now in place, archaeologists are trying to assess damage to UNESCO World Heritage Sites. We visit some.
item.content:encoded: Part of a Crusader castle collapsed. An 18th century minaret toppled. Church mosaics burned. Israeli airstrikes have damaged priceless antiquities across Lebanon & Syria during it's war with Hezbollah. With a ceasefire now in place, archaeologists are trying to assess damage to UNESCO World Heritage Sites. We visit some.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Apple to pay $95 million to settle lawsuit accusing Siri of eavesdropping
item.description: Apple isn't acknowledging wrongdoing in the settlement, which still must be approved by a U.S. District judge. Lawyers in the case have proposed scheduling a Feb. 14 court hearing to review the terms.
item.content:encoded:
Apple isn't acknowledging wrongdoing in the settlement, which still must be approved by a U.S. District judge. Lawyers in the case have proposed scheduling a Feb. 14 court hearing to review the terms.

(Image credit: Marcio Jose Sanchez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 2 dead and several injured in Southern California plane crash
item.description: Two people died and 18 were injured Thursday when a small plane crashed through the roof of a furniture manufacturing building in Southern California, police said.
item.content:encoded:
Two people died and 18 were injured Thursday when a small plane crashed through the roof of a furniture manufacturing building in Southern California, police said.

(Image credit: Jeff Gritchen/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Photos: Bourbon Street reopens in New Orleans after truck attack
item.description: Bourbon Street re-opened in New Orleans Thursday afternoon, more than 24 hours after Wednesday morning's attack by a Texas man driving a Ford pickup truck plowed into a crowd of New Year's revelers.
item.content:encoded:
Bourbon Street re-opened in New Orleans Thursday afternoon, more than 24 hours after Wednesday morning's attack by a Texas man driving a Ford pickup truck plowed into a crowd of New Year's revelers.

(Image credit: Halle Parker)
item.dc:creator: Halle Parker

item.title: Still on the hunt, the FBI shares new details about pipe bombs placed ahead of Jan. 6
item.description: Officials are still trying to identify the person who placed bombs outside of the Democratic National Committee and the Republican National Committee offices in 2021. Now they have fresh details.
item.content:encoded:
Officials are still trying to identify the person who placed bombs outside of the Democratic National Committee and the Republican National Committee offices in 2021. Now they have fresh details.

(Image credit: FBI)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: The oldest living Olympic medal winner, Ágnes Keleti, has died at age 103
item.description: Keleti, who was also a Holocaust survivor, was hospitalized in critical condition with pneumonia on Dec. 25. She died Thursday morning in Budapest, the Hungarian state news agency reported.
item.content:encoded:
Keleti, who was also a Holocaust survivor, was hospitalized in critical condition with pneumonia on Dec. 25. She died Thursday morning in Budapest, the Hungarian state news agency reported.

(Image credit: Laszlo Balogh)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
